title: CS302 Midterm: Network Fundamentals
instructions: Closed-book style: rely on concepts, not copy/paste.
Answer all questions; passing is 70% or higher.
Fill-in questions expect lowercase, trimmed answers.

questions.prompt: Which OSI layer is responsible for end-to-end delivery and flow control?
questions.explanation: The Transport Layer (Layer 4) handles end-to-end communication, flow control, and reliability.

questions.prompt: The TCP/IP model has ____ layers, while the OSI model has 7 layers.
questions.explanation: TCP/IP has 4 layers: Application, Transport, Internet, and Network Access.

questions.prompt: At which OSI layer does a router operate?
questions.explanation: Routers operate at Layer 3 (Network), making decisions based on IP addresses.

questions.prompt: In network encapsulation, each layer adds its header to the front of the data from the layer above.
questions.explanation: Encapsulation adds headers as data moves down the stack; decapsulation removes them going up.

questions.prompt: What is the PDU name at the Transport layer?
questions.codeSnippet:
# OSI PDU names from top to bottom:
# Layer 7,6,5: Data
# Layer 4: ?
# Layer 3: Packet
# Layer 2: Frame
# Layer 1: Bits
questions.explanation: At the Transport layer, the PDU is called a Segment (for TCP) or Datagram (for UDP).

questions.prompt: Which network topology has the highest fault tolerance?
questions.explanation: Full mesh provides the highest redundancy as every node connects to every other node.

questions.prompt: A MAC address is how many bits long?
questions.explanation: MAC addresses are 48 bits (6 bytes), typically shown as six pairs of hex digits.

questions.prompt: The first 3 bytes of a MAC address identify the manufacturer and are called the ____ (abbreviation).
questions.explanation: OUI stands for Organizationally Unique Identifier, assigned by IEEE to manufacturers.

questions.prompt: CSMA/CD is used in modern switched Ethernet networks.
questions.explanation: Modern switched Ethernet uses full-duplex, eliminating collisions. CSMA/CD was for shared media.

questions.prompt: What does ARP resolve?
questions.explanation: ARP (Address Resolution Protocol) maps IP addresses to MAC addresses on a local network.

questions.prompt: What is the Hamming distance between these two bit strings?
questions.explanation: Comparing bit by bit: positions 1, 2, 3, and 4 differ (0≠1, 1≠0, 1≠0, 0≠1), so Hamming distance is 4.

questions.prompt: What is the subnet mask for a /24 network in dotted decimal?
How many usable host addresses are in a /26 subnet?
questions.codeSnippet:
# /26 means 26 network bits
# Host bits = 32 - 26 = 6
# Total addresses = 2^6 = 64
# Usable = total - 2 (network and broadcast)
questions.explanation: A /26 has 6 host bits = 64 addresses. Minus network and broadcast = 62 usable hosts.

questions.prompt: The private IP range 192.168.0.0/16 is commonly called Class ____ private addresses.
questions.explanation: 192.168.x.x falls in the Class C range (192-223 first octet). Common for home networks.

questions.prompt: Given IP 10.45.67.89 with mask 255.255.255.0, what is the network address?
ICMP Echo Request (ping) uses TCP for reliability.
questions.explanation: ICMP is a separate protocol that operates directly over IP, not using TCP or UDP.

questions.prompt: What happens when a router receives a packet with TTL=1?
options: Drops it and sends ICMP Time Exceeded
Sends it back to the source
questions.explanation: When TTL reaches 0 after decrement, the packet is dropped and ICMP Time Exceeded is sent.

questions.prompt: In CIDR notation, 172.16.0.0/12 uses ____ bits for the network portion.
questions.explanation: The /12 directly indicates 12 bits for the network, leaving 20 bits for hosts.

questions.prompt: What is the broadcast address for 192.168.1.0/24?
questions.codeSnippet:
# Network: 192.168.1.0
# Mask: 255.255.255.0
# Broadcast = network with all host bits = 1
questions.explanation: For /24, the last octet is host bits. Set all to 1: 192.168.1.255

questions.prompt: Which transport protocol provides reliable, ordered delivery?
questions.explanation: TCP provides reliability through acknowledgments, retransmission, and sequence numbers.

questions.prompt: TCP uses a ____-way handshake to establish connections.
questions.explanation: TCP connection: SYN, SYN-ACK, ACK - the three-way handshake.

questions.prompt: What is the range of well-known ports?
questions.explanation: Well-known ports are 0-1023, registered ports are 1024-49151, dynamic are 49152-65535.

questions.prompt: If a TCP segment has sequence number 1000 and carries 500 bytes, what will the receiver ACK?
questions.codeSnippet:
# Sequence number: 1000
# Data length: 500 bytes
# ACK = next expected byte
questions.explanation: ACK number = sequence + data length = 1000 + 500 = 1500 (next expected byte).

questions.prompt: UDP provides flow control through a sliding window mechanism.
questions.explanation: UDP has no flow control, congestion control, or reliability mechanisms. TCP has these.

questions.prompt: Which port number is used by HTTPS by default?
questions.explanation: HTTPS uses port 443 by default. HTTP uses port 80.

questions.prompt: The TCP header checksum covers the header, data, and a ____ header.
questions.explanation: TCP checksum includes a pseudo-header with source/dest IP, protocol, and TCP length.

title: CS302 Final: Comprehensive Networks
instructions: Covers all topics from the course.
Answer all questions; passing is 70% or higher.
Fill-in answers are case-insensitive and trimmed.

questions.prompt: Which layer of the OSI model handles data compression and encryption?
questions.explanation: The Presentation layer (Layer 6) handles data formatting, compression, and encryption.

questions.prompt: A switch operates at Layer 2 and uses MAC addresses to forward frames.
questions.explanation: Switches learn MAC addresses and forward frames based on the destination MAC.

questions.prompt: The process of adding headers as data moves down the protocol stack is called ____.
questions.explanation: Encapsulation wraps data with headers at each layer; decapsulation unwraps them.

questions.prompt: In a full mesh network of 10 nodes, how many links are required?
questions.explanation: Full mesh links = n(n-1)/2 = 10(9)/2 = 45 links.

questions.prompt: What is the minimum bandwidth (in Mbps) needed to transfer 100 MB in 10 seconds?
questions.codeSnippet:
# File size: 100 MB = 100 × 8 = 800 Mbits
# Time: 10 seconds
# Bandwidth = size / time
questions.explanation: 100 MB = 800 Mbits. 800 Mbits / 10 seconds = 80 Mbps minimum.

questions.prompt: What type of frame is sent to MAC address FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF?
questions.explanation: FF:FF:FF:FF:FF:FF is the broadcast address, reaching all devices on the local network.

questions.prompt: The IEEE 802.1Q standard defines ____ tagging for Ethernet frames.
questions.explanation: 802.1Q adds a 4-byte VLAN tag to Ethernet frames for network segmentation.

questions.prompt: CRC can correct single-bit errors in transmitted data.
questions.explanation: CRC detects errors but cannot correct them. Hamming codes can correct single-bit errors.

questions.prompt: In the sliding window protocol, what happens when the window is full?
questions.explanation: When the window is full, the sender must wait for ACKs to slide the window forward.

questions.prompt: STP (Spanning Tree Protocol) prevents ____ in switched networks.
questions.explanation: STP prevents layer 2 loops by blocking redundant paths and creating a tree topology.

questions.prompt: How many /27 subnets can be created from a /24 network?
questions.codeSnippet:
# /24 has 8 host bits
# /27 has 5 host bits
# Additional network bits = 27 - 24 = 3
# Subnets = 2^3
questions.explanation: 3 additional network bits allow 2³ = 8 subnets.

questions.prompt: Which routing protocol uses distance-vector algorithm?
questions.explanation: RIP uses distance-vector (hop count). OSPF and IS-IS use link-state.

questions.prompt: NAT allows multiple private IP addresses to share a single public IP address.
questions.explanation: NAT translates private addresses to public, allowing many devices to share one public IP.

questions.prompt: In routing, the ____ prefix match rule selects the most specific route.
questions.explanation: Longest prefix match chooses the route with the most matching bits (most specific).

questions.prompt: Which IPv4 address class supports the most hosts per network?
questions.explanation: Class A has 24 host bits, supporting ~16.7 million hosts per network.

questions.prompt: Are 10.5.5.5 and 10.5.6.5 in the same /23 subnet?
questions.codeSnippet:
# IP1: 10.5.5.5
# IP2: 10.5.6.5
# Mask /23 = 255.255.254.0
# Check if network portions match
questions.explanation: 10.5.5.5 is in 10.5.4.0/23 (covers .4.x and .5.x). 10.5.6.5 is in 10.5.6.0/23 (covers .6.x and .7.x). Different subnets.

questions.prompt: What TCP flag is sent in the first packet of a connection?
questions.explanation: The client sends SYN to initiate the three-way handshake.

questions.prompt: TCP slow start doubles the congestion window until it reaches ____.
questions.explanation: Slow start doubles cwnd each RTT until ssthresh, then switches to congestion avoidance.

questions.prompt: UDP has a fixed 8-byte header.
questions.explanation: UDP header is always 8 bytes: source port, dest port, length, checksum (2 bytes each).

questions.prompt: What is the maximum TCP window size using window scaling factor of 8?
questions.codeSnippet:
# Base window: 16 bits = 65535
# Scale factor: 8 means shift left by 8
# Max = 65535 × 2^8
questions.explanation: 65535 × 256 = 16,776,960 bytes (approximately 16 MB window).

questions.prompt: Which mechanism prevents a fast sender from overwhelming a slow receiver?
questions.explanation: Flow control (receive window) prevents sender from overwhelming receiver's buffer.

questions.prompt: TCP uses ____ to identify retransmission timeout, calculated from RTT samples.
questions.explanation: RTO (Retransmission Timeout) is calculated from estimated RTT and RTT deviation.

questions.prompt: In NAT, which type translates multiple private addresses to a single public address using ports?
questions.explanation: PAT (Port Address Translation) or NAPT uses port numbers to multiplex connections.

questions.prompt: MPLS labels are used for forwarding decisions instead of IP lookups.
questions.explanation: MPLS routers make forwarding decisions based on labels, faster than IP routing.

questions.prompt: QoS uses ____ bits in the IP header for traffic classification (IPv4).
questions.explanation: The ToS (Type of Service) field, now called DSCP, is used for QoS classification.

questions.prompt: Which load balancing algorithm sends each new connection to a different server in order?
questions.explanation: Round Robin cycles through servers in order, distributing connections evenly.

questions.prompt: How many tokens does a token bucket with rate 100/sec and size 500 have after being empty for 3 seconds?
questions.codeSnippet:
# Rate: 100 tokens/second
# Bucket size: 500 (max)
# Empty for 3 seconds
# Tokens = min(rate × time, bucket_size)
questions.explanation: 100 × 3 = 300 tokens. This is less than bucket size 500, so 300.

questions.prompt: BGP uses the ____ path length as one criterion for route selection.
questions.explanation: BGP prefers routes with shorter AS (Autonomous System) paths.

questions.prompt: Which socket type is used for TCP connections?
questions.explanation: SOCK_STREAM is for TCP (reliable, connection-oriented). SOCK_DGRAM is for UDP.

questions.prompt: A UDP socket must call listen() before receiving data.
questions.explanation: UDP is connectionless. Only TCP servers call listen() to accept connections.

questions.prompt: The select() function allows monitoring multiple sockets for ____.
questions.explanation: select() monitors sockets for read/write readiness events (I/O multiplexing).

questions.prompt: Which socket operation blocks until a client connects?
questions.explanation: accept() blocks waiting for incoming connections on a listening socket.

questions.prompt: What is returned by recv() when the peer closes the connection gracefully?
questions.codeSnippet:
# TCP connection
# Peer sends FIN (close)
# recv() returns...
questions.explanation: recv() returns 0 bytes (empty) when the peer closes the connection.

questions.prompt: To reuse a socket address immediately after closing, set the ____ socket option.
questions.explanation: SO_REUSEADDR allows binding to a port in TIME_WAIT state.

questions.prompt: What HTTP method is used to update an existing resource?
questions.explanation: PUT updates an existing resource. POST creates new resources.

questions.prompt: DNS uses port ____ for queries (both TCP and UDP).
questions.explanation: DNS uses port 53. UDP for standard queries, TCP for zone transfers or large responses.

questions.prompt: HTTP/2 allows multiple requests over a single TCP connection.
questions.explanation: HTTP/2 multiplexes multiple streams over one connection, eliminating head-of-line blocking.

questions.prompt: Which SMTP response code indicates success?
questions.explanation: 250 is "OK" in SMTP. 220 is greeting, 354 is "start mail", 550 is error.

questions.prompt: What HTTP status code indicates "Not Found"?
questions.codeSnippet:
# Common HTTP status codes:
# 200 = OK
# 301 = Moved Permanently
# 400 = Bad Request
# ??? = Not Found
# 500 = Internal Server Error
questions.explanation: 404 Not Found indicates the requested resource doesn't exist on the server.

questions.prompt: Which DNS record type maps a domain name to an IPv6 address?
questions.explanation: AAAA records map to IPv6. A records map to IPv4. MX is for mail servers.

questions.prompt: WebSocket connections start with an HTTP ____ request.
questions.explanation: WebSocket uses HTTP Upgrade mechanism to switch from HTTP to WebSocket protocol.

questions.prompt: TLS operates between the Transport and Application layers.
questions.explanation: TLS sits above TCP (Transport) and below HTTP (Application), providing encryption.
